messages.message: What happened to the “Clear chat” button :put_litter_in_its_place:? I don’t have it on aihub-sandbox.internal
Design asked to take it out - it shouldn't be in that spot and with that icon, and they decided it would be better to not have it than to have it there. @Natasha @alagu
Hmm but that’s quite an important functionality. Especially with the conversation memory enabled. There is no way to send a standalone prompt now
@Natasha @alagu do you all want me to put it back, in a different place or with a different icon?
We wanted to move it to a different location in the project menu
@Sławek Biel also question about that - is it ideal that you have to clear the entire chat to be able to send a standalone prompt?
@Jessica do you have a minute to sync?
Oh and you know what, I think the functionality is still present in conversation settings
Maybe this is off mark, but if that's what you use "clear chat" for, maybe there should be a "disregard conversation context" option when sending a message instead
just a little far to get to
@Natasha can you find a temporary place for clear chat till top nav is rolled out
I know we discussed aligning to the top of the chat log in the past
I've already backported the change to take it out so I'll need to backport the change for the new home too.
@Sławek Biel, do we need to add it somewhere else if it's also in project settings? How frequent is this action taken? Sorry, we should have checked on this before taking it out.
I use it often when testing stuff but I’m fine with accessing through the settings. I had thought it’s gone altogether
We will put it back soon in a different spot, sorry for the confusion! We'll also make sure to put this in the release notes.

Also interested to hear your thoughts about an option to not use conversation context for a certain prompt. Would that be at all useful? Would users use that, or is that only really for testing purposes?
Yeah I’d welcome an option to have some visual cue showing which messages are going to be passed to the model and be able to modify it. But it’s a power-user type of feature for sure
